title: @Meddler is it a possible to see some of  cancelled champs to somewhat make it back into the game?

replies.body:
We'll often reuse abilities that were good, but didn't work on one champ, on another. We'll sometimes also go back to an idea we've tried to make previously but haven't been able to find the right version of. Kled for example is kind of the progression of a character we called 'Swordle', a Yordle with a sword and a really exaggerated personality from years ago who didn't work out at the time.

There are a lot of ideas that also just don't hit the mark for one reason or another that we don't go back to. Sometimes things don't work as well in game as you hoped on paper, sometimes we'll conclude there's too much overlap with an existing champion, sometimes a concept just doesn't resonate with the players who should be its audience.

Oh, one point of followup. Something we will be able to do at some point though is give you folks some insight into what some champions looked like during their development (somewhat different abilities etc). Currently working on a dev blog about that with some videos of older prototypes, guess it might be ready sometime next month or so.

A few off the top of the head (apologies if we've already talked about some of these).

* The art that looked a lot like Jhin's release release skin was actually the same art we started with for Kindred's concept too. They were originally a single bounty hunter (gender undefined) who collected bounties, rather than an embodiment of death.

* Ao Shin never had a proper in game model. We did some prototyping on kits for him, that was just using the old SR dragon with its wings removed though (wings removed to make it extra obvious it was something different). It bobbed up and down in a cute, if goofy, way.

* One of Lucian's first prototype kits had an ammo system (like Graves and Jhin now use). The idea showed some promise, it didn't fit as well with the constantly moving, nimble, rapid firing vibe we wanted to hit on for Lucian though, so it got shelved for quite a while.

* Bard's Q at one point was a similar ability to Taliyah's Q (mini Lucian ult with a bit of a rhythm to it). In his case the hits weren't AOE, but if they all landed the target got stunned.

* An early version of Jayce could place Sensor Beacons around the map. They worked kind of like Rek'Sai's tremor Sense, though had a smaller range and limited lifespan. They weren't particularly useful, but were a lot of fun to play around with.

* For the upcoming Rengar rework one of the Bonetooth Necklace versions we tried was a ward that destroyed other wards that were really near it's location (a predatory ward if you will). The idea showed some potential, it was overkill on Rengar though (he doesn't need additional ability to get onto targets unseen). Thematically it also felt a bit weird on him - general feedback was it felt more like a hextech effect (signal jammer or something) than a mechanical trap like Rengar would use.

As a content creator myself, I can tell you that not every idea is or should be brought to fruition. They were rejected for a reason, not for shits and giggles. People nearly committed ritualistic suicide over Ao Shin turning into Aurelion Sol, not realizing that this sort of thing happens literally ALL THE TIME. Ideas change over time; Riot just made the mistake of revealing what's behind the curtain to people who don't understand.

Since I started publishing stories online, I have over 150 published stories, not including the artwork I've done, and not including rewrites of older stories or drafts, and not including the stuff I wrote on physical media or what I had written during my teenage years, before coming to the internet. I moved my stuff to Googledocs just in case I have another drive crash, and the list of drafts and older material is MASSIVE; it overshadows the things I DID complete.

Lol, i knew what i was getting into when doing that. I can barely imagine the work that must be done to actually complete something in a refined and shareable way, but i could "sense" the proportions somehow. University getting into the way and friends/collaborators losing intrest or moving away also did not help :\ i find myself often thinking over and over the same thing just to apply a change that can be fondamental, but that could get easily trashed away by bigger sweeping changes. And still i try to document and reorder everything, because even thought i do not manage to end anything i want to see the development, what i changed and what i renounced to and why.

I won' t ask what you do - if you did not say it already there' s a reason behind that and i respect it - just know that there is someone here that understands ( welp, a smuch as i can get to glimpse) and that appreciates your kind of work :)

Some things I just begin and forget about for months before I come back to it and actually finish it. Other things have either small or big issues that I was never able to get around. One current project of mine started off as Yu Yu Hakusho fanfiction, but then it turned into its own thing once I realized that the Yu Yu Hakusho part was only a very small part. Now I have to comb through everything I've written and figure out what will stay and what will go.

I also have some game design documents that, again, are largely unfinished because I don't have the resources to begin making stuff, or because I'd never be able to actually make them. One is a design document for a remake of SaGa Frontier, an old PS1 game by Squaresoft that was released very much unfinished. No way would a remake for THAT ever happen, but I wrote the document back in 2011 for shits and giggles.

It doesn't help that I work at a janky pace because this is all a hobby, and there's no real career or financial incentive to have me muscle through the Writer's Block.
